meanings.sent1: Her constant hypercriticism made it hard to enjoy anything.
meanings.sent2: The hypercriticism of the movie by the critics was unfair.
meanings.sent3: His hypercriticism of the new recipe made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The hypercriticism of her artwork cut deeper than any knife.

meanings.definition: The act of excessively criticizing or finding fault with something.
meanings.sent1: The hypercriticism of his work was demoralizing.
meanings.sent2: She faced constant hypercriticism from her boss.
meanings.sent3: Their hypercriticism of the weather forecast was comical.
meanings.sent4: The hypercriticism of the new policy was like a storm of negativity.
meanings.sent5: The hypercriticism in the meeting room created a tense atmosphere.
